subject: Productivity
title: The Invention of Mechanical Clocks
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Invention of Mechanical Clocks.

hook.text: In 1300s Europe, monks needed precise prayer times. Their solution changed civilization.

buildup.text: Mechanical clocks with gears and escapements appeared in church towers across medieval Europe.

discovery.text: For the first time, towns shared a single public time source. The bell tower ruled the schedule.

twist.text: Clocks didn't just measure time. They created a new social contract: punctuality.

climax.text: Before clocks, lateness didn't exist as a concept. Mechanical time made it a moral failing.

punchline.text: Clocks didn't just tell time. They invented lateness.

quiz.question: What need drove the invention of mechanical clocks in Europe?
options: Merchants needed to track trade hours
